item.title: PlayStation Plus Game Catalog Adding 8 New Games In October
item.content:encoded:
Sony has announced the new games coming to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog in October. These new games will be available for players starting October 21.

Of the games available, the biggest titles coming to the library are Silent Hill 2 and Yakuza: Like a Dragon.

Most of the games will be available for both PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium members. However, there’s one game that’s exclusive to Premium subscribers: Tekken 3.

You can check out the full list of games coming to the service below. As mentioned above, all of the games will be available on October 21. In addition to the games below, you can still get access to October’s free monthly games available for all subscribers until November 3.

PlayStation Plus Game Catalog Games October 2025

PlayStation Plus Extra and Premium | Game Catalog

  • Silent Hill 2 | PS5
  • Until Dawn | PS5
  • V Rising | PS5
  • Yakuza: Like a Dragon | PS5, PS4
  • Poppy Playtime: Chapter 1 | PS5, PS4
  • As Dusk Falls | PS5, PS4
  • Wizard with a Gun | PS5

PlayStation Plus Premium | PS VR2 & Classics

  • Tekken 3 | PS5, PS4

What do you think of the games being added to the PlayStation Plus Game Catalog in October? Leave your thoughts down in the comments below, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read the latest surrounding the recent Discord hack and what files the group responsible claims to have. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Battlefield 6 Naval Warfare Content is Already in Development, Datamines Reveal

It appears that Battlefield 6’s future naval warfare content is already in development, according to datamined files found by Insider Gaming.

Halo Master Chief voice actor has teased that ‘big news’ is coming later this month, during the upcoming deep dive event.

Escape from Tarkov Hits 500,000 Wishlists on Steam

Escape from Tarkov has secured a spot on more than 500,000 wishlists on Steam, according to Battlestate Games’ latest update.

Battlefield 6 Devs Are ‘Rolling Out a Fix’ for Bullets Not Registering

Battlefield 6 players will be happy, as developers are rolling out a fix for the issue where bullets aren’t registering.

item.title: Battlefield 6 Naval Warfare Content is Already in Development, Datamines Reveal
item.content:encoded:
It appears that Battlefield 6’s future naval warfare content is already in development, according to datamined files found by Insider Gaming.

According to some strings of code obtained by Insider Gaming, it appears that several different vehicles are currently in development for Battlefield 6, including Jet Skis and RHIBs (Rigid-Hulled Inflatable Boats).

Both strings of code were attached to the multiplayer files, suggesting that work on naval combat is already well underway in some capacity. The lines read:

Game/GlacierMP/Kits/Vehicle_Neutral_Boat_JetSki
Game/GlacierMP/Kits/Vehicle_Neutral_Boat_RHIB

For those out of the loop, “Glacier” is the codename for Battlefield 6, whereas “MP” is the abbreviation for multiplayer.

However, we’ve also heard from the Battlefield 6 developers themselves that naval combat requests, which have been highly requested by the community, “have not gone unnoticed.”

As for when naval combat will be introduced in Battlefield 6, it is unclear. However, judging by the Season 1 content, which appears to lack maps with vast amounts of water, we might be waiting for a while. That said, a fully dedicated season to naval warfare is something that Battlefield has done before and could easily do again with Battlefield 6.

You can read Insider Gaming’s review of Battlefield 6, for which we gave it a 4/5 due to the game’s somewhat lackluster campaign.

What do you think of Battlefield 6 adding naval warfare? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Battlefield 6 developers rolling out a fix for bullets not registering. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: All Pokémon Legends: Z-A Mable’s Research Rewards, Listed
item.content:encoded:
Research tasks are back with a vengeance in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, with Mable dishing out challenges to complete to improve your level and gain some exclusive rewards, and we’ve got a full list available to you.

While Legends: Arceus had you collecting data for the first Pokédex to be built, Legends: Z-A sees Mable researching why a large influx of wild Pokémon have made their way to Lumiose City, and she recruits your assistance to help her achieve her goals.

Mable’s Research in Pokémon Legends: Z-A is the only way to get your hands on extremely beneficial rewards, so it’s worth keeping a close eye on the requests.

Mable’s Research provides a heap of rewards in Pokémon Legends: Z-A, including a large variety of powerful TMs and Experience Candy to help level-up your party.

Many of the rewards are required for exploration, like Rock Smash for removing boulders obstructing your path, while others serve as game-changing additions in battle with the ability to one-shot opponents or deal huge amounts of damage.

A full list of the rewards available and the required level are shown in the table below.

Your level in Mable’s Research is completed by completing Research Requests issued by Mable, which unlock through story progression.

Initial challenges include registering a set number of species of Pokémon in your Pokédex, catching Pokémon of a specific type, and winning battles. Completing these requests grants Points, which tally together to increase your rank.

Later down the line, however, more Points are required to increase your level, and the Research Requests will become harder to accomplish, thus serving as long-term goals to complete even after the main story of Legends: Z-A is boxed off.

What starter did you choose in Pokémon Legends: Z-A? Let us know your choice in the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Pokémon Legends: Z-A, find out how to redeem codes to claim pre-order bonuses, and take a look at details of the extensive character customization features.
